text:
I am new to Tomcat.  I did not find this topic or description already entered 
under the bug list or the doc provided via the Tomcat site.  Please feel free 
to point me to documentation and websites and such.  

In IIS, I can restrict access to directory folders and files easily.  How do I 
do the same in Tomcat?  I notice that anything under webapps can be accessed 
via FTP including the conf folder where sensitive information resides.

Thanks!

I'm confused by this, could please provide some additional information?  First, 
if your really using 3.1.1 then it would be a good idea to upgrade to 3.2.2.

Second, Tomcat doesn't know anything about about FTP, if your using FTP to see 
Tomcat configuration files it means that your FTP server is poorly configured.  
The Servlet API Specification is quite specific about what files may and may 
not be served by the container and the latest version Tomcat adheres to this 
specification (there were security holes in earlier versions which is why its 
good to upgrade).
